chunks.cleaned_english_translation: These things will be beneficial in the future if they are possessed in the present life. The blessed Apostle knew and taught this, instructing us to live soberly, justly, and devoutly in this world. He emphasized that those who will receive mercy in the judgment are those who have led a just life before the judgment. This is why divine Scripture advises us in the book of Ecclesiasticus: "Prepare justice for yourself before the judgment, and you will find mercy in the sight of God" (Ecclesiasticus 18:19). Therefore, anyone who desires to find mercy in the sight of God should prepare justice for themselves now. What a person does not store up in this present world, they will not have at the time of future retribution. To demonstrate this sufficiently with testimonies from divine Scriptures, let us first conclude this book so we can then appropriately begin the remaining part of the question.
chunks.original_latin:
Haec autem tunc in futura vita proderunt, si in
vita saeculi praesentis habeantur. Hoc enim beatus
et sciebat et docebat Apostolus, qui praecipiebat ut
sobrie et juste et pie vivamus in hoc saeculo (Ibid ):
docens scilicet illos adepturos in judicio misericordiam,
qui ante judicium in hoc saeculo justam gesserint
 vitam. Propter quod nos in libro Ecclesiastico
divina praemonet Scriptura, dicens: Ante judicium
para justitiam tibi, et in conspectu Dei invenies propitiationem
(Eccli XVIII 19). Debet itaque hic sibi
justitiam praeparare, quisquis in conspectu Dei propitiationem
desiderat invenire. Quod enim in praesenti
saeculo sibi homo non thesaurizaverit, futurae
retributionis tempore non habebit. Quod ut divinarum
testimoniis Scripturarum quantum sat est possit
ostendi, primum terminemus librum, ut consequenter
parti residuae quaestionis congruum dare possimus
exordium.
